title: requirment86
description:
4.3.1     This  sub-section  defines  the  core  environmental  and  physical  requirements  for  all 
EIRENE mobile equipment. The requirements provided in this section are augmented 
by those provided in later sections for each individual radio type, with each radio type 
being specified by the superset of the core plus specific requirements. (I)

title: requirment87
requirment88
description:
4.3.3     In normal operation of a mobile radio unit, it is expected that a combination of the 
above environmental conditions will be experienced. (I)

title: requirment89
description:
4.3.4     Any environmental and physical requirements stated may be superseded by national 
requirements if the national standards provide a higher level of environmental and 
physical protection. However, stricter national standards shall not prevent the use of 
other EIRENE mobiles in that country. (M)

title: requirment90
description:
4.3.5     All design, testing and installation of EIRENE mobile radio equipment shall comply 
with the quality procedures defined in ISO 9001 . (M) 
Climatic conditions

title: requirment91
description:
4.3.6     Any pressure pulses caused by vehicles passing, entering or leaving tunnels shall not 
affect the normal operation of EIRENE mobile equipment. (M) 
Physical conditions

title: requirment92
requirment93
description:
4.3.8     All EIRENE mobile equipment shall be capable of being operated on board rolling 
stock. (M) 
Electrical

title: requirment94
description:
4.3.9     The  batteries  to  be  used  in  the  mobile  equipment  shall  have  sufficient  capacity  to 
support typical railway use. (M) 
Electromagnetic Compatibility

title: requirment95
description:
4.3.10     EIRENE  mobiles  will  generate  electromagnetic  emissions.  It  is  the  responsibility  of 
national railways operating EIRENE networks to ensure that EIRENE equipment does 
not interfere with the normal operation of any on-train or ground-based systems. (I)

title: requirment96
requirment97
description:
5.1.1     This section identifies the functional requirements for the EIRENE Cab radio. It covers 
the functionality provided by the Cab radio, driver MMI and support to other on-train 
systems. (I)

title: requirment98
description:
5.1.2     Moreover,  a  driver  may  be  provided  with  a  handheld  portable  to  allow 
communications whilst the driver is outside the train. (O)

title: requirment99
description: 5.2.1.1     In this subsection, the functions to be provided by the Cab radio are described. (I)

title: requirment100
description:
5.2.1.2     The following functions will be provided:  
Driver call-related functions: 
						

								     call controller: (M) 
							

								     primary controller; 
							

								     secondary controller; 
							

								     power supply controller; 
							

								     call other drivers in the area; (M) 
							

								     send Railway emergency call; (M) 
							

								     confirm receipt of Railway emergency call; (M) 
							

								     communicate with other drivers on same train; (M) 
							

								     call train staff; (M) 
							

								     call other authorised users; (M) 
							

								     receive incoming voice calls; (M) 
							

								     terminate calls; (M) 
							

								     receive text messages; (M) 
							

								     enter/leave shunting mode; (M) 
							

								     enter/leave direct mode; (O) 
							

								     monitor calls to other on-train users/devices; (M) 
							

								     forward calls/cancel call forwarding to/from driver handheld; (O)  Other driver-related functions: 
							

								     powering up radio; (M) 
							

								     switch radio MMI on and off; (M) 
							

								     select language; (M) 
							

								     adjust loudspeaker volume; (M) 
							

								     select mobile radio network; (M) 
							

								     register and deregister train number; (M) 
							

								     register and deregister on-train users; (O) 
							

								     register and deregister stock number; (M) 
							

								     store/retrieve numbers and their details; (M) 
							

								     invoke supplementary services; (M) 
							

								     invoke tests; (M)  Other Cab radio functions: 
							

								     automatic connection of incoming calls to appropriate on-train users or devices  (conductor, public address system, data systems, etc); (M) 
							

								     automatic establishment of outgoing calls initiated by on-train users or devices; (M) 
							

								     automatic handling of calls of varying priorities; (M) 
							

								     send to the controller(s) a signal on activation of driver safety device; (M) 
							

								     transmit Railway emergency call event indication to train-borne recorder; (M) 
							

								     run-time diagnostics. (O)

title: requirment101
description:
5.2.2i   Once a call has been established the connected parties shall be able to communicate. 
(M) 5.2.2iv  A Push-To-Talk function shall be provided for use during group calls. (M)

title: requirment102
description:
5.2.2ii   Picking up the handset shall transfer the communication to the handset and reduce the 
loudspeaker volume to its minimum level. (M)

title: requirment103
description:
5.2.2iii  Replacing the handset either: (M) 
						

								     cancels the call; or 
							

								     transfers the call to the loudspeaker at the initial volume.

title: requirment104
description: 5.2.2iv   A Push-To-Talk function shall be provided for use during group calls. (M)

title: requirment105
description:
5.2.2v   The  use  of  Push-To-Talk  for  all  types  of  communications  is  acceptable  if  needed  for 
ergonomic reasons or to avoid the noise of the cab being transmitted to the other party. 
(I)

title: requirment106
requirment107
description:
5.2.2.2     If the radio system cannot give a unique identity for a given type of controller, the 
identity could be obtained using external systems as defined in 11.4.7. (I)

title: requirment108
description:
5.2.2.3     Once an appropriate destination has been obtained, the radio shall attempt to establish 
a call to this destination. The functional identity shall be displayed to the controller. 
(M)

title: requirment109
description:
5.2.2.3i  The functional identity includes the following: 
						

								     the train number, if available; (M) 
							

								     the engine number, if no train number is available; (M) 
							

								     the  coach  number  of  the  leading  cab,  if  neither  a  train  number  nor  an  engine  number is available. (O)

title: requirment110
description:
5.2.2.4     An  audible  and  visual  indication  shall  be  provided  to  the  driver  that  the  call  is 
proceeding. (M)

title: requirment111
description:
5.2.2.5     When the call is connected to the controller, an audible and visual indication is to be 
provided to the driver. The call shall be connected to the loudspeaker at the pre-set 
value. (M)

title: requirment112
description:
5.2.2.6     The functional identity of the connected party, if available, shall be displayed to the 
driver. (M)

title: requirment113
description:
5.2.2.7     If the functional identity of the connected party contains an alphanumeric description, 
this shall also be displayed. (M)

title: requirment114
description:
5.2.2.8     If the system is not able to connect the call, an audible and visual indication shall be 
provided to the driver that the call was not received by the controller. This shall also 
indicate if the called party was busy or if the network could not connect the call. (M) 
Call other drivers in the area (on other trains)

title: requirment115
description:
5.2.2.9     It shall be possible for a driver to initiate and participate in group voice calls between 
drivers in a pre-defined geographical area. (M)

title: requirment116
description:
5.2.2.10 A driver shall be able to initiate the establishment of a call to other drivers with a    
minimum of action (eg a single keystroke). (M)

title: requirment117
description:
5.2.2.11 The group identity shall be displayed on the Cab radios of the participating drivers.    
(M)

title: requirment118
description:
5.2.2.12 An  audible  and  visual  indication  shall  be  provided  to  the  driver  that  the  call  is    
proceeding. (M)

title: requirment119
description:
5.2.2.13 Once connected, the driver shall be able to communicate with other driver(s) by using    
the Push-To-Talk button on the handset. An indication shall be provided to the driver 
as a reminder of the need to use the Push-To-Talk button on the handset if he wants to 
talk. (M)

title: requirment120
description:
5.2.2.14 The call shall be connected to the loudspeaker until the driver picks up the handset.    
(M)

title: requirment121
description:
5.2.2.15 The call shall continue until terminated by the calling driver, an authorised controller    
or the network. (M)

title: requirment122
description:
5.2.2.16 If the train moves out of the group call area whilst the call is in progress, an audible    
and visual indication of the loss of call shall be provided to the driver. (M)

title: requirment123
description:
5.2.2.17 If the system is not able to connect the call, an audible and visual indication shall be    
provided to the driver. (M) 
Send Railway emergency call

title: requirment124
description: 5.2.2.18 It shall be possible for a driver to initiate Railway emergency calls (see section 13). (M)

title: requirment125
description:
5.2.2.19 If  a  train-borne  recorder  is  connected  to  the  Cab  radio,  details  of  the  activation,    
termination and any failures of the emergency function shall be sent to the train-borne 
recorder as each event occurs. (M)

title: requirment126
description:
5.2.2.20 A continuous visual and short audible indication (from 0 to 20 seconds, for trials: 5    
seconds) that the emergency function has been activated shall be provided in the cab. 
(Note that when the handset is off-hook, the audible indication shall be sounded from 
the loudspeaker at a low volume, but shall not be sounded from the handset.) (M)

title: requirment127
description:
5.2.2.21 Once the Railway emergency call is connected and the audible indication is finished,    
an indication shall be provided to the driver as a reminder of the need to use the Push-
To-Talk button on the handset if he wants to speak. (M)

title: requirment128
description:
5.2.2.22 The call shall be connected to the loudspeaker until the driver picks up the handset.    
(M)

title: requirment129
description:
5.2.2.23 If the train moves out of the call area whilst the call is in progress, it will leave the call    
and an audible and visual indication of the loss of call shall be provided to the driver. 
(M)

title: requirment130
description:
5.2.2.24 Once the call is terminated, the continuous visual alarm indication in the cab shall    
cease. (M)

title: requirment131
description:
5.2.2.25 If the system is not able to connect the call, an audible and visual indication shall be    
provided to the driver. (M) 
Communicate with other drivers on same train

title: requirment132
description:
5.2.2.26 Many trains employ multiple active traction vehicles. Where these vehicles are not    
connected  by  on-train  wire  connections,  it  shall  be  possible  for  the  lead  driver  to 
establish a permanent radio connection between each of the active cabs. (M)

title: requirment133
description: 5.2.2.27 The call will be established from the active cab of the lead traction vehicle. (I)

title: requirment134
description:
5.2.2.28 Whilst on-going, a multi-drivers indication shall be displayed permanently at all Cab    
radios. (M)

title: requirment135
description:
5.2.2.29 The lead driver shall be notified if a member of the group has placed the call on hold,    
although this shall not affect communications between the remaining members of the 
group. (M)

title: requirment136
description:
5.2.2.30 At any time during the call, the lead driver shall be able to remove a member of the    
group. (M)

title: requirment137
description: 5.2.2.31 The lead driver shall be able to terminate the entire call. (M)

title: requirment138
description:
5.2.2.32 If a driver is disconnected from the multi-driver call, a clear indication shall be given.    
(M)

title: requirment139
description:
5.2.2.33 The  setting  up  and  closing  down  of  a  multi-driver  call  shall  be  simplified  using    
automation or guidance through the steps required. (M)

title: requirment140
description:
5.2.2.34 In each cab, the call shall be connected to the loudspeaker whilst the handset is on-   
hook. (M)

title: requirment141
description:
5.2.2.35 If any part of the call fails, an audible and visual indication shall be provided in the    
appropriate cab. (M)

title: requirment142
description:
5.2.2.36 If the call fails in the lead traction vehicle, the lead driver will be responsible for re-   
establishing the call. If the call fails to any other cab, the driver in that cab will call the 
lead cab and request re-establishment of the call. (I)

title: requirment143
description:
5.2.2.37 For calls between a controller and the lead cab, it shall be possible to add the controller    
to the multi-driver call. Either the lead driver calls the controller or the controller calls 
the lead driver. In the latter case, the controller is automatically added into the multi-
driver call. Functional identity of the controller shall be displayed in the leading cab.   
(M) 
Call train staff

title: requirment144
description:
5.2.2.38 It shall be possible for the driver to contact members of on-board train staff using a    
point-to-point voice call. (M)

title: requirment145
requirment146
description:
5.2.2.40 The driver shall then be prompted to select the train staff with which he wishes to    
communicate. (M)

title: requirment147
description:
5.2.2.41 On many trains, staff may be connected by intercom or internal telephone rather than    
by  radio.  It  is  required  that,  in  these  cases,  the  Cab  radio  shall be  integrated  with 
internal communication systems such that the appropriate means of connection (wire 
or radio) will be determined automatically. (M) 
Call other authorised users

title: requirment148
requirment149
description: 5.2.2.43 An audible and visual indication of an incoming call shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment150
description:
5.2.2.44 The functional identity (which may contain an alphanumeric description) of the calling    
party, when available, shall be displayed. (M)

title: requirment151
description:
5.2.2.45 Point-to-point calls that are not automatically answered (see table 10-1) shall only be    
answered once the driver accepts the call. (M)

title: requirment152
description:
5.2.2.46 Once the driver has accepted the standard point-to-point call, it shall be connected    
appropriately, eg if the driver has accepted the call by lifting the handset, then the call 
shall be routed to the handset. (M) 
Receive incoming group or broadcast voice call

title: requirment153
description:
5.2.2.47 An audible and visual indication of the incoming call shall be provided when a Cab    
radio receives a group or broadcast call. (M)

title: requirment154
description: 5.2.2.48 The group identity of the voice group call (VBS or VGCS) shall be displayed. (M)

title: requirment155
description:
5.2.2.49 Group or broadcast calls shall automatically be connected to the loudspeaker if the    
handset is not in use, or to the handset if the handset is off hook. (M)

title: requirment156
description:
5.2.2.50 The  driver  shall  be  informed  if  a  broadcast  call  is  ongoing  by  a  visual  indication    
displayed on the MMI. (M)

title: requirment157
description:
5.2.2.50i  It is not possible for the driver to speak as part of the call when receiving a broadcast 
call. (I)

title: requirment158
description:
5.2.2.51 If the call is a group call, the driver shall be required to request permission before    
being able to speak as part of the call by lifting the handset and pushing the Push-To-
Talk (PTT) button. (M)

title: requirment159
description:
5.2.2.52 During a group call, a visual indication shall be displayed on the drivers MMI to    
remind the driver of the need to use the PTT button. (M)

title: requirment160
description:
5.2.2.53 The driver can not speak in a group call until permission is granted by the network    
after pushing the PTT button. (I)

title: requirment161
description:
5.2.2.54 In a group call, an audible and visual indication of whether the request to talk was    
successful shall be provided. The driver shall then be able to speak as part of the call 
whilst the PTT button is pressed. (M)

title: requirment162
description:
5.2.2.55 If the train moves out of the group or broadcast call area whilst the call is in progress,    
an audible and visual indication of the loss of call shall be provided to the driver. (M) 
Receive incoming Railway emergency call

title: requirment163
description:
5.2.2.56 Reception of this call proceeds as for a standard group or broadcast call, except that a    
distinctive audible and visual indication shall be provided in the cab. (M)

title: requirment164
description:
5.2.2.57 If a train-borne recorder is connected to the Cab radio, details of an incoming Railway    
emergency  call  shall  be  transmitted  to  the  train-borne  recorder  for  recording,  see 
section 5.8. (M) 
Confirm receipt of Railway emergency call

title: requirment165
description:
5.2.2.58 An  automatic  confirmation  shall  be  generated  by  the  Cab  radio  at  the  end  of  the    
Railway emergency call as detailed in section 13. (M)

title: requirment166
description:
5.2.2.59 Automatic confirmation of receipt of Railway emergency calls will be used to provide a    
means  of  determining  which  trains  have  received  a  Railway  emergency  call  (see 
section 13). (I) 
Terminate calls

title: requirment167
description:
5.2.2.60 The  Cab  radio  shall  provide  a  means for  the driver  to  terminate  calls  which he  is    
authorised to terminate (ie all calls except Railway emergency calls not initiated by the 
driver and shunting group calls). (M)

title: requirment168
description:
5.2.2.61 For group or broadcast calls, a means to leave the call without terminating the call shall    
be provided. (M) 
Receive text messages

title: requirment169
requirment170
description:
5.2.2.63 The  Cab  radio  shall  support  a  shunting  mode  of  operation  that  provides  a  link    
assurance  tone  to  reassure  users  of  the  integrity  of  the  communication  link  (see  
section 14). (M)

title: requirment171
description: 5.2.2.64 A means to enter and leave shunting mode shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment172
description:
5.2.2.65 The functionality to enter and leave shunting mode shall not be available when there    
are on-going calls involving the Cab radio. (M)

title: requirment173
description: 5.2.2.66 The link assurance tone shall be provided via the loudspeaker. (M)

title: requirment174
description:
5.2.2.67 If the Cab radio is equipped with an additional security device, this audible indication    
may be muted for the drivers convenience. In this case, the security device alerts the 
driver if the link has failed or if it is cancelled. (I) 
Enter/leave direct mode

title: requirment175
description:
5.2.2.68 It should be possible for the Cab radio to be used without the network service (if it    
should fail or if there is no authorised network coverage), such that local open channel 
communications are still possible. This mode of operation is termed direct mode (see 
section 15). (O)

title: requirment176
description:
5.2.2.69 If  direct  mode  is  implemented,  a  means  to  enter  and  leave  direct  mode  shall  be    
provided. (M)

title: requirment177
description:
5.2.2.70 If the radio is in direct mode and the normal network service returns, the user shall be    
provided with an audible and visual indication. (M) 
Monitor calls to other on-train users/devices using the Cab radio

title: requirment178
description:
5.2.2.71 Not all communications using the Cab radio will involve the driver. Where these calls    
involve the Cab radio, the driver shall be provided with an indication that the Cab 
radio is busy. (M)

title: requirment179
description:
5.2.2.72 For voice calls using the Cab radio not involving the driver as a called or calling party,    
the driver shall have the possibility to listen to the audio output of the communication. 
(M)

title: requirment180
description:
5.2.2.73 For voice communications, if the driver picks up the handset, the radio shall allow him    
to join the communication. (M)

title: requirment181
description:
5.2.2.74 The  driver  shall  be  able  to  terminate  communications  (voice  or  data)  by  selecting    
another call. (M) 
Forward calls to driver handheld

title: requirment182
requirment183
requirment184
description:
5.2.3.2     At the point of successful connection, the Cab radio will be able to receive all calls 
made using the Cab radios telephone number, engine number or appropriate group 
call numbers (including Railway emergency calls). (I)

title: requirment185
description:
5.2.3.3     Powering down the Cab radio shall cause the disconnection of the Cab radio from the 
mobile network. (M)

title: requirment186
description:
5.2.3.4     When switched off, the radio shall retain any numbers which are stored at the time the 
radio is switched off. (M) 
Switch radio MMI on/off

title: requirment187
description:
5.2.3.5     The  MMI  on/off  control  shall  be  designed  to  prevent  accidental  activation/ 
deactivation. (M)

title: requirment188
requirment189
description:
5.2.3.7     When  the  MMI  is  switched  on,  the  configuration  shall  be  determined  by  the  time 
elapsed since the MMI was last switched off: (M) 
						

								     less than   minutes  the MMI shall power up with the same configuration as when   t it was last powered down; 
							

								     greater than   minutes  the MMI shall power up with default settings.   t

title: requirment190
description:
5.2.3.8     The time   should be able to be varied between 0 and 240 minutes, as a maintenance   t
function,  allowing  the  radio  to  power  up  in  a  consistent  state  following  minor 
operational procedures or power interruptions. (O)

title: requirment191
requirment192
description: 5.2.3.10 As far as possible, the above procedure should also apply on power failure. (O)

title: requirment193
requirment194
description:
5.2.3.12 It shall be possible to present radio related prompts and information in a number of    
different languages. (M)

title: requirment195
description:
5.2.3.13 By default, prompts and information shall be displayed in the language selected by the    
train owner (as stored within the system). (M)

title: requirment196
description:
5.2.3.14 It shall be possible for the user to display a list of available languages and select the    
language in which radio related prompts and information are displayed both at turn 
on and during a journey (eg where a change of drivers may occur). (M)

title: requirment197
description: 5.2.3.15 The languages to be supported will be a matter for each national railway to decide. (I)

title: requirment198
description:
5.2.3.16 The radio shall support at least ten different languages. (M)    
Adjust loudspeaker volume

title: requirment199
description:
5.2.3.17 By default, the loudspeaker volume shall be set to a pre-determined level suitable for    
the operating environment (as stored within the system). (M)

title: requirment200
description:
5.2.3.18 It shall be possible for the driver to increase and decrease the loudspeaker volume    
within the adjustment range selected. (M)

title: requirment201
description:
5.2.3.19 When the handset is picked up, the loudspeaker shall continue to operate, but at a    
reduced volume level. (M)

title: requirment202
description: 5.2.3.20 Deleted.

title: requirment203
description: 5.2.3.21 Deleted.

title: requirment204
description:
5.2.3.22 Deleted.    
Manual network selection

title: requirment205
description:
5.2.3.23 Using a simple MMI action, it shall be possible for the driver to view a prioritised list    
of all authorised mobile radio networks (see section 10.5). (M)

title: requirment206
description:
5.2.3.23i  When presented with this list, it shall be possible for the driver (using simple MMI 
actions) to select the required mobile radio network manually, whereupon the Cab 
radio shall attempt to attach to this selected network. (M)

title: requirment207
description:
5.2.3.24 The manual network selection function shall not be available when there are on-going    
voice calls involving the Cab radio. (M)

title: requirment208
description:
5.2.3.25 A visual confirmation of the new network identity shall be given to the driver when a    
manually initiated network change has been completed successfully. (M) 5.2.3.25v Directed network selection is suitable for crossing international borders. (I) 
Automatic network selection 5.2.3.25vi The Cab radio should be capable of selecting the mobile radio network automatically 
from a list of suitable networks (see section 10.5). (O) 5.2.3.25vii If automatic network selection is implemented, it shall be possible for the driver to 
activate and deactivate automatic network selection. (M) 5.2.3.25viii Automatic network selection shall not be used for international border crossing. (M) 5.2.3.25x If directed network selection and/or automatic network selection are implemented, 
the driver shall be informed by means of an audible and visual indication of the new 
network identity whenever a network change takes place without user intervention. 
(M) 
Register and deregister train number

title: requirment209
description:
5.2.3.25i Manual network selection is suitable for crossing international borders. (I) 
Directed network selection 5.2.3.25iv If directed network selection is implemented, input from the external device(s) shall 
initiate the network change regardless of the identity of the current network and how 
it was selected. (M) 5.2.3.25ix Automatic network selection is not suitable for use in areas where there is a risk that 
the Cab radio will change to a foreign network unpredictably. (I)

title: requirment210
description:
5.2.3.25ii The Cab radio should be capable of selecting the mobile radio network as directed by 
input from an external device (eg a balise). (O)

title: requirment211
description:
5.2.3.25iii If directed network selection is implemented and voice calls are ongoing at the time 
when the external device attempts to trigger a network change, an audible and visual 
indication shall be given to the driver and network change shall be deferred until the 
call is terminated or until coverage of the current network is lost. (M)

title: requirment212
description:
5.2.3.25v Directed network selection is suitable for crossing international borders. (I) 
					Automatic network selection

title: requirment213
description:
5.2.3.25vi The Cab radio should be capable of selecting the mobile radio network automatically 
from a list of suitable networks (see section 10.5). (O)

title: requirment214
description:
5.2.3.25vii If automatic network selection is implemented, it shall be possible for the driver to 
activate and deactivate automatic network selection. (M)

title: requirment215
description: 5.2.3.25viii Automatic network selection shall not be used for international border crossing. (M)

title: requirment216
description:
5.2.3.25ix Automatic network selection is not suitable for use in areas where there is a risk that 
the Cab radio will change to a foreign network unpredictably. (I)

title: requirment217
description:
5.2.3.25x  If  directed  network  selection  and/or  automatic  network  selection  are  implemented, 
the driver shall be informed by means of an audible and visual indication of the new 
network  identity  whenever  a  network  change  takes  place  without  user  intervention. 
(M) 
Register and deregister train number

title: requirment218
description:
5.2.3.26 It  shall  be  possible  for  the  driver  to  register  and  deregister  a  train  number  in  the    
following ways:  
1)  enter train number; (M) 
2)  initiate automated request (applicable only for leading driver). (O)

title: requirment219
description:
5.2.3.27 Where the driver is required to enter the train number information, the information    
entered shall be shown on the display and require confirmation by the driver before 
further actions are possible. (M)

title: requirment220
description:
5.2.3.28 If an automated request is initiated (option 2), the driver shall be able to accept or reject    
the train number returned by the network. (M)

title: requirment221
description:
5.2.3.28i Where ERTMS/ETCS and radio systems are available and the driver is required to 
enter the train number as part of the initialisation procedure, this task shall be carried 
out only once on the ERTMS/ETCS system and the entered number transmitted to the 
radio system. (M)

title: requirment222
description:
5.2.3.28ii  Data entry may be from either system depending on the operating procedures agreed 
between the train operator and the railway infrastructure operator. (I)

title: requirment223
description:
5.2.3.29 The driver shall be warned (by audible and visual indications) if a train with the same    
train number is already registered on the same network. (M)

title: requirment224
description:
5.2.3.30 A means to override the currently registered train number shall be provided to the    
newly registering driver. (M)

title: requirment225
description:
5.2.3.31 The driver of the previously registered train shall be informed (by audible and visual    
indications) that his train number has been overridden by another driver. (M)

title: requirment226
description:
5.2.3.32 Where a change of train number is required during the course of a trains journey, it    
shall be possible for the driver to initiate the change or override the automatic change. 
This shall be carried out by entering the train number (option 1 in 5.2.3.26). (M)

title: requirment227
description:
5.2.3.33 Non leading drivers shall be able to indicate to the system their location in the train    
during the registration procedure (2nd driver, 3rd driver etc). (M) 
Register and deregister on-train users (on-train functions)

title: requirment228
description:
5.2.3.34 The drivers functional number shall be automatically registered/deregistered when    
the train number is registered/deregistered. (M)

title: requirment229
description:
5.2.3.35 The functional number of other on-train users who may be addressed through the Cab    
radio via the on-train bus shall be registered/deregistered automatically at the same 
time as the registration/deregistration of the drivers functional number. (M)

title: requirment230
description:
5.2.3.36 Where  an  on-train  bus  is  connected  to  the  Cab  radio,  deregistration  of  functional    
numbers can be performed on an individual basis and also by the train driver, by one 
action for all users (including the driver), at the end of the journey when the train 
number is no longer associated with the train. (O) 
Register and deregister stock number (engine/coach number)

title: requirment231
description:
5.2.3.37 There shall be a fixed relationship between the telephone numbers of radios installed    
in the locomotive/coach and the stock number, which shall remain even if the radio is 
changed. (M)

title: requirment232
description:
5.2.3.38 It shall be possible to register and deregister a stock number in one or both of the    
following ways: (M) 
						

								     automatically using information from on-board systems;  
							

								     automatically via a fixed interface between the locomotive/coach and the radio.  Store/retrieve numbers and their details

title: requirment233
description:
5.2.3.39 The Cab radio shall have a reconfigurable list of stored numbers that may be used to    
perform abbreviated dialling to named user identities. (M)

title: requirment234
description:
5.2.3.40 It  shall  be  possible  for  the  driver  to  find  and  display  stored  numbers  and  their    
information. (M)

title: requirment235
description:
5.2.3.41 It should be possible for the driver to store and overwrite numbers and their details in    
the Cab radio. (O) 
Invoke supplementary services

title: requirment236
description:
5.2.3.42 General MMI functions are required to support the following call functions:    
						

								     forward call to the driver handportable; (O) 
							

								     put a call on hold; (M) 
							

								     display incoming call details whilst in an on-going call; (M) 
							

								     temporarily exit an existing call to answer another incoming call; (M) 
							

								     multi-driver call service. (M)

title: requirment237
description:
5.2.3.43 The actions required from the driver will be as simple as possible. (I)    
Invoke tests

title: requirment238
description:
5.2.3.44 It shall be possible to initiate tests of the radio to provide the driver with a reasonable    
level of certainty that the radio and MMI are working. (M)

title: requirment239
description: 5.2.3.45 Such tests shall not prevent calls. (M)

title: requirment240
description:
5.2.3.46 The result of the tests shall be displayed in a similar format to the self-test when MMI    
is powered on. (M)

title: requirment241
description:
5.2.4.1     The Cab radio system may be required to be able to handle incoming and outgoing 
calls not only to and from the driver, but also to and from other on-train users and 
devices (conductor, public address system, data systems, etc) via appropriate interfaces 
and ports. (I)

title: requirment242
description: 5.2.4.2     For data applications, calls shall be possible even if the driver MMI is switched off. (M)

title: requirment243
description:
5.2.4.3     The Cab radio may need to conserve battery power when the radio is powered up but 
the MMI is switched off. (I) 
Handling of call priorities

title: requirment244
description:
5.2.4.4     The Cab radio may be required to set up calls from a number of different sources. 
Therefore, the radio shall provide a priority function for calls from different sources in 
order to handle contention for the radio. (M)

title: requirment245
description:
5.2.4.5     In order to meet other call priorities, established calls shall be able to be either put on 
hold or cleared down (pre-empted). (M)

title: requirment246
description:
5.2.4.6     The  Cab  radio  shall  be  capable  of  handling  contention  between  calls  of  differing 
priorities. (M)

title: requirment247
description:
5.2.4.7     An  outgoing  call  request  of  higher  priority  than  an  established  call  shall  take 
precedence over the established call. (M)

title: requirment248
description:
5.2.4.8     Where pre-emption occurs, an advisory indication may be provided to the pre-empted 
parties. (O)

title: requirment249
description:
5.2.4.9     Priority  call  handling  facilities  shall  be  provided  such  that  the  performance 
requirements defined in sections 3.4 and 10.2 can be met. (M) 
Run-time diagnostics

title: requirment250
description:
5.2.4.10 Upon the request of the driver, the Cab radio should be able to perform a suite of run-   
time diagnostic tests on all physical interfaces. (O)

title: requirment251
description:
5.2.4.11 If run-time diagnostics are implemented, failure of an interface shall be reported to the    
driver via the display. (M)

title: requirment252
description:
5.2.4.12 If run-time diagnostics are implemented, all failures should be available to be recorded    
in a train-borne recorder. (O)

title: requirment253
description:
5.2.4.13 If  run-time  diagnostics  are  implemented,  diagnostic  tests  shall  not  interfere  with    
normal operation of the Cab radio. (M)

title: requirment254
description:
5.2.4.14 Railways will require facilities to support the use of automatic test equipment with    
mobile radios. (I)

title: requirment255
description:
5.3.1     Train-mounted  equipment  including  the  Cab  radio  terminal  equipment,  MMI  and 
antenna shall comply with all specifications in section 4.3 and all of those defined in 
this section. (M)

title: requirment256
description:
5.3.2     The radio equipment that will be mounted in rolling stock can be split into two classes: 
in-cab  equipment  and  external  equipment.  Each  type  of  equipment  has  slightly 
different requirements placed upon it in terms of EMC and climate. (UIC fiche 651  is a 
useful reference concerning the layout of cab equipment.) (I) 
Physical conditions

title: requirment257
description:
5.3.3     Measures should be taken to reduce the risk of theft of radio equipment. Examples of 
such measures include physical protection, alarms and access control measures. (I)

title: requirment258
description:
5.3.4     Ease of maintenance should be taken into account in the design and installation of 
radio equipment. For example, maintenance access to antennas on vehicles should be 
provided. (I) 
Electrical

title: requirment259
requirment260
description:
5.3.6     Requirements on electromagnetic emissions for the Cab radio are to be more stringent 
than those defined for other radio types due to close proximity to other train-mounted 
control and protection equipment, and higher transmission power. (I)

title: requirment261
requirment262
description:
5.4.2     Radio equipment installed in a drivers Cab shall not obstruct the drivers vision or 
otherwise hinder the safe driving of the train. (M)

title: requirment263
description:
5.4.2i   The design of the equipment shall make it possible to install it within a cab complying 
with the requirements of UIC fiche 651 concerning the layout of cab equipment . (M)

title: requirment264
description: 5.4.3     All call related functions shall be possible with the handset on or off the hook. (M)

title: requirment265
description: 5.4.4     Note: there is no requirement for hands free operation. (I)

title: requirment266
description:
5.4.5     The  driver  shall  be  able  to  adjust  the  brightness  of  buttons,  indicator  lights  and 
displays according to the ambient lighting in the cab. (M)

title: requirment267
description: 5.4.6     The driver shall be able to adjust the contrast of the display. (M)

title: requirment268
description:
5.4.7     The emergency call button shall be red and shall be protected against accidental use. 
(M)

title: requirment269
description:
5.4.8     Any displays shall be clearly readable from a normal drivers position, assuming a 
normal reading distance. (M)

title: requirment270
description: 5.4.9     Displayed characters shall have a minimum height of 5mm. (M)

title: requirment271
requirment272
description:
5.4.11     The standard set of audible and visual indications specified in the CENELEC Standard 
for the Driver-Machine Interface for ERTMS shall be implemented in the Cab radio 
system. (M)

title: requirment273
description: 5.4.12     Deleted.

title: requirment274
requirment275
description:
5.4.14     Where there is a risk that stored numbers or other set-up details may be accidentally 
changed,  facilities  should  be  provided  on  the  Cab  radio  in  order  to  prevent  this 
happening. (O)

title: requirment276
description:
5.4.15     Cab radios shall provide a means of preventing tampering. (M) 
Service availability

title: requirment277
description:
5.4.16     If  contact  with  the  mobile  radio  network  is  lost,  then  the  Cab  radio  shall  give  an 
audible and visual indication. (M)

title: requirment278
description: 5.5.1     Deleted.

title: requirment279
description: 5.6.1     Deleted.

title: requirment280
description:
5.7.1     A driver safety device (DSD) interface should be provided in traction units that are 
equipped with a DSD in order to support the transmission of a DSD alarm. (O)

title: requirment281
description:
5.7.1i   If such an interface is implemented, it shall be capable of being connected to a device 
complying  with  UIC  fiche  641   concerning  automatic  vigilance  devices  used  in 
international traffic. (M)

title: requirment282
description:
5.7.2     The activation of the driver safety device shall automatically trigger the Cab radio to 
send a data message. (M)

title: requirment283
description:
5.7.3     The DSD alarm call/message shall provide the following information: 
					

							     train number; (M) 
						

							     engine number; (M) 
						

							     location information. (O)

title: requirment284
description: 5.7.4     DSD alarm information shall be transmitted to the primary controller. (M)

title: requirment285
description: 5.7.5     Additional information may also be provided if available from external systems. (O)

title: requirment286
description:
5.8.1     The  Cab  radio  shall  be  able  to  provide  the  following  information  to  a  train-borne 
recorder or other equipment via a standardised interface:  
					

							     activation of Cab radio emergency call button; (M) 
						

							     receipt of incoming Railway emergency call; (M) 
						

							     termination of outgoing or incoming Railway emergency call; (M) 
						

							     radio faults; (O) 
						

							     driver safety device alarm message transmission; (M) 
						

							     details of confirmation of Railway emergency call. (M)

title: requirment287
description: 5.9.1     On-train mobiles shall provide a standardised interface to ERTMS/ETCS. (M)

title: requirment288
description:
5.9.2     In  addition,  individual  railways  may  have  requirements  to  interface  to  national 
control/command systems. (I)

title: requirment289
description: 5.10.1     Other interfaces may be provided in the Cab radio system. (O)

title: requirment290
description:
6.1.1     This section identifies the functional requirements for General purpose radio. It covers 
the functionality to be provided by the General purpose radio and the man-machine 
interface (MMI) is also defined. (I)

title: requirment291
description:
6.2.1.1     In  this  section,  the  functions  to  be  provided  by  the  General  purpose  radio  are 
described. (I)

title: requirment292
description:
6.2.1.2     The following functions will be provided:  
Call related functions 
						

								     call authorised users (including controllers); (M) 
							

								     send Railway emergency calls; (O) 
							

								     receive Railway emergency calls; (O) 
							

								     receive incoming calls; (M) 
							

								     group and broadcast calls; (M) 
							

								     terminate calls; (M)  Other functions 
							

								     switch radio on and off; (M) 
							

								     select language; (M) 
							

								     select mobile radio network; (M) 
							

								     adjust loudspeaker volume; (M) 
							

								     register and deregister functional numbers; (M) 
							

								     store/retrieve numbers and their details; (M) 
							

								     computer interface. (O)

title: requirment293
description:
6.2.2.1     The General purpose radio shall be capable of use as a standard telephone, such that 
the user is able to call any valid number subject to call restrictions enforced by the 
network. (M) 
Send Railway emergency call

title: requirment294
description:
6.2.2.2     The facility for a given General purpose radio to send a Railway emergency call (see 
section 13) shall be determined as a management function. (M)

title: requirment295
description:
6.2.2.3     A special MMI action shall be required for a General purpose radio user to send a 
Railway emergency call. (M)

title: requirment296
description:
6.2.2.4     It  shall  not  be  possible  for  any  General  purpose  radio  user  to  send  a  Railway 
emergency call by dialling a short code or telephone number. (M) 
Receive incoming point to point voice call

title: requirment297
description: 6.2.2.5     An audible and visual indication of an incoming call shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment298
description:
6.2.2.6     Where available, the functional identity of the calling party shall be displayed. (M) 
Receive incoming group or broadcast voice call

title: requirment299
description: 6.2.2.7     A short audible and visual indication of the incoming call shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment300
description: 6.2.2.8     The group identity of the voice group call (VBS or VGCS) shall be displayed. (M)

title: requirment301
description:
6.2.2.9     If the call is a broadcast call, the user shall be informed that he cannot speak as part of 
the broadcast call. (M)

title: requirment302
description:
6.2.2.10 If the call is a group call, the user has to request permission to speak during the call by    
using the Push-To-Talk (PTT) function. (M)

title: requirment303
description:
6.2.2.11 In a group call, a visual indication shall be provided to remind the user of the need to    
use the PTT function. (M)

title: requirment304
description:
6.2.2.12 The user may not speak in a group call until permission is granted by the network after    
using the PTT function. (I)

title: requirment305
description:
6.2.2.13 In a group call, an audible and visual indication of whether the request was successful    
shall be provided. The user may then talk whilst the PTT function is used. (M)

title: requirment306
description:
6.2.2.14 If the user moves out of the group or broadcast call area whilst the call is in progress,    
an audible and visual indication of the loss of call shall be provided to the user. (M) 
Receive incoming Railway emergency call

title: requirment307
description:
6.2.2.15 Reception  of  this  call  (if  implemented)  shall  proceed  as  for  a  standard  group  or    
broadcast call except that a distinctive audible and visual indication shall be provided. 
(M) 
Terminate calls

title: requirment308
description:
6.2.2.16 The radio shall provide a means for the user to terminate calls which he is authorised    
to terminate (ie all calls except broadcast or group calls not initiated by the user). (M)

title: requirment309
requirment310
description:
6.2.3.2     At this point, the radio will be able to receive all calls initiated using the telephone 
number or appropriate group call number. (I)

title: requirment311
requirment312
description:
6.2.3.4     When switched off, the radio shall retain any settings and numbers which are stored at 
the time the radio is switched off. (M) 
Select language

title: requirment313
description:
6.2.3.5     Prompts and messages shall be capable of being displayed in at least 10 languages 
(each railway will choose which languages will be implemented). (M)

title: requirment314
description:
6.2.3.6     The user shall be able to select his preferred language for the display; this setting shall 
be retained by the radio. (M)

title: requirment315
description:
6.2.3.7     When the radio is first powered on, the language that appears on the display shall be 
the default one set by the national railway. (M) 
Select mobile radio network

title: requirment316
description:
6.2.3.8     Where  more  than  one  mobile  radio  network  is  available  for  use  by  a  mobile,  the 
selection of the network to use shall be automatic (see section 10.5). (M)

title: requirment317
description:
6.2.3.9     When the mobile changes network automatically, a visual and audible indication shall 
be given. (M)

title: requirment318
description:
6.2.3.9i  It shall be possible for a user to override the automatic network selection manually. 
This function shall not be available during calls. (M) 
Register and deregister functional number

title: requirment319
description:
6.2.3.10 It shall be possible to register and deregister a functional number in the following way:     
						

								     Initiated by the user and transmitted to the ground: 
							

								     user enters functional number which is transmitted to the network. (M)

title: requirment320
description:
6.2.3.11 Where a change of functional number is required, it shall be possible for the user to    
initiate the change. (M) 
Store/retrieve numbers and their details

title: requirment321
description:
6.2.3.12 It  shall  be  possible  for  the  user  to  find  and  display  stored  numbers  and  their    
information. (M)

title: requirment322
description:
6.2.3.13 It shall be possible for the user to store and/or overwrite numbers and their details in    
the radio. (M) 
Computer interface

title: requirment323
description:
6.2.3.14 A standard data interface should be provided to allow a computer to be connected to    
the radio. (O)

title: requirment324
description:
6.3.1     The  full  environmental  and  physical  specification  of  the  General  purpose  radio  is 
intended  to  be  as  close  as  possible  to  that  of  a  Commercial-Off-The-Shelf  (COTS) 
mobile whilst adhering to the specifications provided in section 4.3 and this section. (I) 
Physical conditions

title: requirment325
description: 6.3.2     The General purpose radio should be small, compact and easy to carry. (I)

title: requirment326
description: 6.3.3     It should be possible for a user to change the battery without the use of tools. (O)

title: requirment327
description:
6.3.4     The weight of the General purpose radio including battery should not exceed 250g. (O)  
Electrical

title: requirment328
requirment329
description: 6.3.6     Changing the battery should not result in losing data stored in the radio. (O)

title: requirment330
description: 6.3.7     The General purpose radio should be suitable for use with a car adapter kit. (O)

title: requirment331
requirment332
description: 6.4.1.2     The MMI should be suitable for use both by day and night. (O)

title: requirment333
description:
6.4.2.1     The on/off control should be designed to prevent accidental activation/deactivation. 
(O)

title: requirment334
description: 6.4.2.2     Facilities should be provided to adjust the loudspeaker volume. (O)

title: requirment335
description:
6.4.2.3     A Push-To-Talk function shall be provided. The Push-To-Talk function does not need 
to be a dedicated button. (M)

title: requirment336
description:
6.4.2.4     Four buttons should be provided for designated stored numbers. These buttons need 
not be dedicated buttons. (This facility is required to allow calls to specified users to be 
initiated quickly.) (O)

title: requirment337
description:
6.4.2.5     Stored  numbers  and  other  set-up  details  should  be  protected  against  accidental 
alteration. (O)

title: requirment338
description:
6.4.2.6     If the ability to initiate Railway emergency calls is implemented in the radio, accidental 
initiation of a Railway emergency call shall be prevented. (M)

title: requirment339
description:
6.4.3.1     A visual and audible indication shall be given when the remaining capacity of the 
battery is such as to enable only 10 minutes of full duplex call time. (M)

title: requirment340
description: 6.4.3.2     A network service availability indication shall be provided to the user. (M)

title: requirment341
description:
6.4.3.3     A visual indication shall be provided to the user if the network service is no longer 
available. (M)

title: requirment342
description:
6.4.3.4     An  audible  indication  should  be  provided  to  the  user  if  the  network  service  is  no 
longer available. (O)

title: requirment343
description:
7.1.1     This section identifies the functional requirements for the EIRENE Operational radio. It 
covers the functionality to be provided by the Operational radio and the man-machine 
interface (MMI) is also defined. (I)

title: requirment344
description: 7.2.1.1     In this section, the functions to be provided by the Operational radio are described. (I)

title: requirment345
description:
7.2.1.2     The following functions will be provided: 
Call related functions 
						

								     call authorised users; (M) 
							

								     call controller; (M) 
							

								     send Railway emergency calls; (M) 
							

								     receive Railway emergency calls; (M) 
							

								     receive incoming calls; (M) 
							

								     group and broadcast calls; (M) 
							

								     terminate calls; (M) 
							

								     shunting mode communications; (O)  
							

								     enter/leave direct mode; (O)  Other functions 
							

								     switch radio on/off; (M) 
							

								     select language; (M) 
							

								     select mobile radio network; (M) 
							

								     adjust loudspeaker volume; (M) 
							

								     register and deregister functional number; (M) 
							

								     store/retrieve numbers and their details; (M) 
							

								     computer interface. (O)

title: requirment346
description:
7.2.2.1     The Operational radio shall be capable of use as a standard telephone, such that the 
user  is  able  to  call  any  valid  number  subject  to  call  restrictions  enforced  by  the 
network. (M) 
Call controllers

title: requirment347
description:
7.2.2.2     It shall be possible for the user of an Operational radio to establish a call with each of 
the following types of controller (who are not permanently included in a shunting 
group) with a minimum number of actions being required: 
						

								     primary controller; (M) 
							

								     secondary controller; (M) 
							

								     power supply controller. (O)

title: requirment348
description:
7.2.2.3     For some users, particularly for shunting team leaders, up to twenty valid numbers 
may be stored for one controller type. In these cases, the identities of the controllers 
corresponding to these valid numbers shall be displayed with an audible and visual 
prompt for one to be selected. The number of the controller selected shall then be used 
to establish the call. If no selection is made by the user within 10 seconds the radio 
shall abandon the call attempt. (O)

title: requirment349
description:
7.2.2.4     Once an appropriate number has been obtained, the radio shall attempt to establish a 
call to this number with railway operation priority. (M)

title: requirment350
description:
7.2.2.5     An  audible  and  visual  indication  shall  be  provided  to  the  user  that  the  call  is 
proceeding. (M)

title: requirment351
description:
7.2.2.6     When the call is connected to the controller, an audible and visual indication shall be 
provided to the user. (M)

title: requirment352
description:
7.2.2.7     The functional identity of the connected party, if available, shall be displayed to the 
user. (M)

title: requirment353
description:
7.2.2.8     Where available, an alphanumeric description of the identity of the connected party 
shall be displayed. (M)

title: requirment354
description:
7.2.2.9     If the system is not able to connect the call, an audible and visual indication shall be 
provided to the user. (M) 
Send Railway emergency call

title: requirment355
description:
7.2.2.10 The Railway emergency call shall be able to be initiated using a single red button (see    
section 13). (M)

title: requirment356
description:
7.2.2.11 It should be possible, as a maintenance function, to enable/disable the emergency call    
function. (O)

title: requirment357
description:
7.2.2.12 If  the  emergency  call  function  is  disabled,  a  visual  indication  and  short  audible    
indication shall be given when:  
						

								     the radio is switched on; (M) 
							

								     the emergency button is pushed (in this case nothing else will happen). (M)  Receive incoming point to point voice call

title: requirment358
description: 7.2.2.13 An audible and visual indication of an incoming call shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment359
description:
7.2.2.14 Where available, the functional identity of the calling party shall be displayed. (M)    
Receive incoming group or broadcast voice call

title: requirment360
description: 7.2.2.15 A short audible and visual indication of the incoming call shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment361
description: 7.2.2.16 The group identity of the voice group call (VBS or VGCS) shall be displayed. (M)

title: requirment362
description:
7.2.2.17 If the call is a broadcast call, the user shall be informed that he cannot speak as part of    
the broadcast call. (M)

title: requirment363
description:
7.2.2.18 If the call is a group call, the user has to request permission to speak during the call by    
using the Push-To-Talk (PTT) function. (M)

title: requirment364
description:
7.2.2.19 In a group call, a visual indication shall be provided to remind the user of the need to    
use the PTT function. (M)

title: requirment365
description:
7.2.2.20 The user may not speak in a group call until permission is granted by the network after    
using the PTT function. (I)

title: requirment366
description:
7.2.2.21 In a group call, an audible and visual indication of whether the request was successful    
shall be provided. The user may then talk whilst the PTT function is used. (M)

title: requirment367
description:
7.2.2.22 If the user moves out of the group or broadcast call area whilst the call is in progress,    
an audible and visual indication of the loss of call shall be provided to the user. (M) 
Receive incoming Railway emergency call

title: requirment368
description:
7.2.2.23 Reception of this call shall proceed as for a standard group or broadcast call except that    
a distinctive audible and visual indication shall be provided. (M) 
Terminate calls

title: requirment369
description:
7.2.2.24 The radio shall provide a means for the user to terminate calls which he is authorised    
to terminate (ie all calls except broadcast or group calls not initiated by the user). (M) 
Shunting mode communications

title: requirment370
description:
7.2.2.25 The Operational radio should provide facilities to support shunting mode as described    
in section 14. (O)

title: requirment371
description:
7.2.2.26 If shunting mode is implemented, a means to enter and leave shunting mode shall be    
provided. (M)

title: requirment372
description:
7.2.2.27 If shunting mode is implemented, the functionality to enter or leave shunting mode    
shall not be available whilst there are on-going calls involving the Operational radio. 
(M)

title: requirment373
description:
7.2.2.28 If shunting mode is implemented, the link assurance tone shall be provided via the    
loudspeaker. (M) 
Direct mode

title: requirment374
description:
7.2.2.29 A means to enter/leave the direct mode of operation should be provided (see section    
15). (O)

title: requirment375
requirment376
description:
7.2.3.2     At this point the radio should be able to receive all calls initiated using the telephone 
number or appropriate group call number. (I)

title: requirment377
requirment378
description:
7.2.3.4     When switched off, the radio shall retain any settings and numbers which are stored at 
the time the radio is switched off. (M) 
Select language

title: requirment379
description:
7.2.3.5     Prompts and messages shall be capable of being displayed in at least 10 languages 
(each railway will choose which languages will be implemented). (M)

title: requirment380
description:
7.2.3.6     The user shall be able to select his preferred language for the display; this setting shall 
be retained by the radio. (M)

title: requirment381
description:
7.2.3.7     When the radio is first powered on, the language that appears on the display shall be 
the default one set by the national railway. (M) 
Select mobile radio network

title: requirment382
description:
7.2.3.8     Where  more  than  one  mobile  radio  network  is  available  for  use  by  a  mobile,  the 
selection of the network to use shall be automatic (see section 10.5). (M)

title: requirment383
description:
7.2.3.9     When the mobile changes network automatically, a visual and audible indication shall 
be given. (M)

title: requirment384
description:
7.2.3.9i   It shall be possible for a user to override the automatic network selection manually. 
This function shall not be available during calls. (M) 
Register and deregister functional number

title: requirment385
description:
7.2.3.10 It shall be possible to register and deregister a functional number in the following way:     
						

								     Initiated by the user and transmitted to the ground: 
							

								     user enters functional number which is transmitted to the network. (M)

title: requirment386
description:
7.2.3.11 Where a change of functional number is required, it shall be possible for the user to    
initiate the change. (M) 
Store/retrieve numbers and their details

title: requirment387
description:
7.2.3.12 It  shall  be  possible  for  the  user  to  find  and  display  stored  numbers  and  their    
information. (M)

title: requirment388
description:
7.2.3.13 It shall be possible for the user to store and/or overwrite numbers and their details in    
the radio. (M) 
Computer interface

title: requirment389
description:
7.2.3.14 A standard data interface should be provided to allow a computer to be connected to    
the radio. (O)

title: requirment390
description:
7.3.1     The Operational radio shall comply with the basic standards defined for all EIRENE 
mobile equipment in section 4.3 and this section. The Operational radio is specified to 
allow its use in the operating environment experienced on the operational railway (eg 
shunting and maintenance). (I) 
Climatic conditions

title: requirment391
requirment392
description:
7.3.3     The  Operational  radio  shall  be  of  a  rugged  design  suitable  for  use  in  the  railway 
environment by operational railway personnel. (M)

title: requirment393
description:
7.3.4     The Operational radio should have a carry feature that allows the operator to instantly 
have both hands free without dropping the radio. It should be possible to release the 
carry feature instantly in the event that the radio is caught on a projecting part of a 
moving vehicle. (O)

title: requirment394
description:
7.3.5     Controls  shall  be  designed  such  that  they  are  suitable  for  use  by  people  wearing 
gloves. (M)

title: requirment395
description:
7.3.6     Controls shall be designed for use in a wide range of conditions, eg splash proof and 
suitable for viewing in direct sunlight and in darkness. (M)

title: requirment396
description: 7.3.7     It should be possible for a user to change the battery without the use of tools. (O)

title: requirment397
description:
7.3.8     The weight of the Operational radio including battery should not exceed 800g. (O) 
Electrical

title: requirment398
description: 7.3.9     It shall be possible to change the battery without losing data stored in the radio. (M)

title: requirment399
requirment400
description: 7.3.11     The Operational radio should be suitable for use with a car adapter kit. (O)

title: requirment401
requirment402
description: 7.4.1.2     The MMI shall be suitable for use by day and night. (O)

title: requirment403
description: 7.4.2.1     The display shall be capable of displaying at least 6 lines, each of 20 characters. (M    )

title: requirment404
description:
7.4.3.1     Four  buttons  should  be  provided  for  designated  stored  numbers.  (This  facility  is 
required for calls to local controllers, etc.) (O)

title: requirment405
description: 7.4.3.2     The emergency button shall be designed to avoid accidental use. (M)

title: requirment406
description:
7.4.3.3     If shunting mode is implemented, the link assurance button shall be designed to avoid 
accidental use. (M)

title: requirment407
description: 7.4.3.4     A dedicated Push-To-Talk button shall be provided. (M)

title: requirment408
description:
7.4.4.1     A visual and audible alarm shall be given when the remaining capacity of the battery is 
such as to enable only 10 minutes of full duplex call time. (M)

title: requirment409
description:
7.4.4.2     A visual indication shall be provided to the user if the network service is no longer 
available. (M)

title: requirment410
description:
7.4.4.3     An  audible  indication  should  be  provided  to  the  user  if  the  network  service  is  no 
longer available. (O)

title: requirment411
requirment412
description:
8.1.2     Detailed  specification  of  controller  equipment  and  the  interface  between  such 
equipment and the EIRENE network is at the discretion of the railway operator. (I)

title: requirment413
description:
8.1.3     Within a control centres equipment, the radio control functions and presentation may 
be  integrated  within  a  set  of  equipment  used  for  other  control  operations.  The 
following  description  is  based  on  dedicated  equipment  but  does  not  preclude 
integration. (I)

title: requirment414
description:
8.1.4     Details concerning controller equipment requirements for Railway emergency calls are 
given in section 13. (I)

title: requirment415
description:
8.2.1     The primary controllers MMI should provide the following functionality: (O) 
					

							     Queue all incoming calls or call requests. 
						

							     Display the queue to the controller, showing the functional identity and priority of  callers.  High  priority calls  should be  identified  and  presented  at the  top  of  the  queue. 
						

							     Allow the controller to select any of the incoming calls currently queued by the  system. 
						

							     Allow the controller to establish a call of Railway emergency, public emergency or  railway operation priority to any mobile by selection from the display. 
						

							     Allow the controller to establish, close, enter and leave group calls (at Railway  emergency, public emergency or railway operation priority). 
						

							     Allow sending and receiving of text messages.

title: requirment416
description:
8.2.2     For post incident analysis, the controller equipment should provide the possibility to 
record all operational speech and data calls. (O)

title: requirment417
description:
8.2.3     It should be possible for calls to be answered automatically according to incoming call 
priority as defined in section 10.2. (O)

title: requirment418
description:
8.3.1     The functionality required by other types of controllers is essentially the same as for 
primary controllers, but the control area will differ and the call set-up subsystem may 
be integrated into their own function management system. (I)

title: requirment419
description:
8.3.2     At  the  detailed  level,  different  controllers  may  have  specific  addressing  needs,  eg 
catering controllers will need to call specific vehicles in a train. (I)

title: requirment420
description:
8.4.1     The  communications  architecture  will  be  dictated  by  local  circumstances.  The 
definition of this interface is beyond the scope of EIRENE. (I)

title: requirment421
description:
8.5.1     The controller equipment must be designed to function correctly in a railway operating 
environment, such as control centres and signal boxes. (I)

title: requirment422
description:
9.1.1     International  standardisation  of numbering  plans  is  needed  to  ensure  interworking 
between  networks.  Furthermore,  standardised  allocation  of  numbers  to  subscribers 
will facilitate schemes for identification, barring, etc. (I)

title: requirment423
requirment424
description:
9.2.1.1     The  EIRENE  system  shall  enable  users  to  originate  and  receive  calls  by  functional 
number. (M)

title: requirment425
description: 9.2.1.2     Each mobile shall be identified by a unique telephone number. (M)

title: requirment426
description: 9.2.2.1     The use of train numbers to address trains shall not result in any ambiguities. (I)

title: requirment427
description: 9.2.2.2     Every on-train function shall be identified by a unique standard number. (M)

title: requirment428
description:
9.2.3.1     The use of engine/coach numbers to address trains shall not result in any ambiguities. 
(I)

title: requirment429
description: 9.2.3.2     Every on-engine/coach function shall be identified by a unique standard number. (M)

title: requirment430
requirment431
requirment432
requirment433
description:
9.2.4.4     The numbering for other teams shall be treated in the same way as maintenance teams 
in 9.2.4.2. (M)

title: requirment434
description:
9.2.5.1     Group  call  service  areas  shall  be  freely  configurable  within  the  operational 
responsibility of each railway network. (M)

title: requirment435
description:
9.2.6.1     In some countries, train numbers are alphanumeric. Support for such numbers is not 
required for interoperability. (I)

title: requirment436
description:
9.3.1     Telephone numbers can be defined on a national basis, but codes for certain functions 
shall be used on an international basis in order to allow interoperability. (M)

title: requirment437
requirment438
description:
9.4.1     To provide interoperability between the fixed railway networks within the EIRENE 
network, standardisation of UIC group numbering will be required. (I)

title: requirment439
description:
9.4.2     In network boundary areas, the pre-defined local area shall be allocated on a bilateral 
basis. (M)

title: requirment440
description:
9.5.1     Authorised users within the EIRENE network shall be able to receive calls from calling 
parties outside the EIRENE network. (M)

title: requirment441
description:
10.1.1     In  order  to  provide  a  consistent  level  of  service  in  each  railway  network  and,  in 
particular, to ensure interoperability for train drivers and other users roaming between 
networks,  it  is  important  to  harmonise  subscription  details  and  other  information 
stored in the network. (I)

title: requirment442
requirment443

title: requirment445
description:
10.2.3     The lowest priority ongoing call shall be pre-empted before that of a higher priority. 
(M)

title: requirment446
description:
10.2.4     In the case where an EIRENE mobile attempts to make a Railway emergency call over a 
public  network,  the  ability  to  pre-empt  lower  priority  calls  (particularly  public 
emergency calls) may be inhibited, unless a special agreement is in place. (I)

title: requirment447
description:
10.3.1     Various types of call restriction may be employed by the railways as an additional 
security measure. Such facilities may be particularly important if public network access 
to the radio system is provided (eg to prevent members of the public calling drivers 
and drivers calling members of the public). (O)

title: requirment448
description:
10.3.2     Any  implementation  of  such  call  restrictions  shall  not  affect  international 
interoperability. (M)

title: requirment449
description:
10.4.1     A mobile may be a member of a number of groups. It shall be possible to activate or 
deactivate the mobiles subscription to these groups. (M)

title: requirment450
description:
10.4.2     Activating a group on the mobile shall allow a user to receive a call from that group. 
(M)

title: requirment451
description:
10.4.3     Deactivating  a  group  on  the  mobile  shall  prevent  a  user  receiving  calls  from  that 
group. (M)

title: requirment452
description:
10.4.4     In  order  to  provide  interoperability,  Cab  radios  will  be  members  of  a  number  of 
standard groups: 
					

							     Railway emergency call; (M) 
						

							     all train drivers; (M)   
						

							     shunting team; (M) 
						

							     trackside worker. (O)

title: requirment453
description:
10.4.5     All  mobiles  with  Railway  emergency  group  call  subscription(s)  shall  be  prevented 
from deactivating the emergency group(s) whilst operational. (M)

title: requirment454
requirment455
description:
10.5.2     Where EIRENE facilities are not available within the currently selected network, the 
user shall be given a visible indication. (M)

10.6.1     The access matrix defines which subscribers are able to contact which other subscribers 
within the EIRENE network. (M)
